artist: Delineator: After Claude Gellée (called Le Lorrain); Engraver: Richard Earlom; Publisher: John Boydell
description: two figures in a wooded landscape; one figure with pack on a pole over his shoulder; on a path leading to river in left distance
inscription:
Signature, Date, and Inscription

in plate LLC in black: Claude fev | below image in black: Claude delin\'t.  Pub. Jan 20, 1802 by J.&J. Boydell, No. 90 Cheapside, & at the Shakspeare Gallery, Pall Mall,  R. Earlom sculp\'t | on sheet in pencil: 1-674
